Package fr.umlv.retro

Class FileSystem

java.lang.Object
fr.umlv.retro.FileSystem
public final class FileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
Representation of a virtual file system that maintain a reference to opened class files until they are saved on the disk so they can processed multiple times.

When save() method is called, the class will save the the modified class fields on a sub-directory of the root path. So original files are never modified.

      Removes written bytecodes from the memory.

    • write

      public void write​(java.nio.file.Path path, byte[] bytecode)
      Writes the given bytecode at path on the file system.

      Note: the bytecode will not be written on the disk until save() method is called.
      Parameters:
      path - path where to write the bytecode.
      bytecode - bytecode to write.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is null.

    • write

      public void write​(java.nio.file.Path path, java.lang.String className, byte[] bytecode)
      Writes the given bytecode in the class file className on the file system relative to path.

      Note: the bytecode will not be written on the disk until save() method is called.
      Parameters:
      path - path where to write the class.
      className - class name (without an extension)..
      bytecode - bytecode to write.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is null.

    • iterate

      public void iterate​(java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.nio.file.Path,​byte[]> consumer) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      Iterates over the file system to find bytecodes call the given consumer for each bytecode.

      Note: the method will always return last modified version of the bytecode.
      Parameters:
      consumer - function to call for each file.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is null.

    • bytecode

      public void bytecode​(java.nio.file.Path path, java.lang.String className, java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.nio.file.Path,​byte[]> consumer) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      Gets the bytecode of the class className relative to the given path.

      The method will always return the last modified version of the bytecode since the file system is created.
      Parameters:
      path - path where to search the class.
      className - class name
      consumer - bytecode consumer.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is null.
